column1: pitched up, angling away outside off, seams away further. Warner has a loose poke at it in the channel before belatedly pulling his bat away from the line

Ishant squares up Warner and finds the outside edge. It might have carried to third slip. Just one slip in place. Good length and seams away just outside off, Warner has to play at it. Ishant takes the outside edge that runs down to deep third man
very full and outside off, Warner has an opportunity to press forward. Push-driven to mid-off

full and straying into the pads, pitched outside leg, Warner is looking scratchy early on. Can't connect with a flick. The ball kisses the pad and rolls away through the square-leg region. One leg bye
pitches outside leg, comes in, and hits the thigh of Dhawan as he misses with the flick now. The ball wanders away through the covers

Dhawan is now beaten past the outside edge. The opener aims to manufacture a shot. He shimmies down the track, Ishant pulls his length back slightly and finds enough away movement to defeat him. Good first over
easily picked off the pads through square leg
hip-high short ball on the off stump, you've got to get it upto head height, Dhawan steps back and pulls it firmly to the midwicket boundary
this is another hip-high ball, the line is on leg stump, Dhawan simply tickles it fine on its way, fine of short fine leg. Back-to-back fours
back of a length and just a shade outside off, punchily played back to Anureet
length ball on off stump, no room for Dhawan to work with, he hangs back and defends it back to the bowler again
Dhawan uses his feet to the medium-pacer, Anureet drags his length back. Shortish and angling away outside off, Dhawan adjusts and taps the ball to cover to secure a single
length ball on the leg stump, right there to be put away. Instead, Dhawan does not get hold of the flick, and wears it on the pad
full and on the pads, Dhawan picks it up and whips it over backward square leg. Flat six. The wrists and hands did all the work there

short of a length and cuts back in to cramp Dhawan for room. The batsman awkwardly defends the ball just beside his feet and sets off. Warner responds. Ishanr runs in but can't flick it onto the stumps with his boot
tucked off the pads past the leg umpire
Dhawan runs down the track, this is on a back of a length on middle. Punchily driven but straight to the man at mid-off
just short of a good length on off, cramps Dhawan for room, chopped in front of cover
back of a length on the leg stump, no room at all for Dhawan to free his arms. He can only drag an inside edge to square leg
back of a length, aiming for the top of off stump, Warner stands tall, punching it back to Mohit
length ball on off stump, Warner takes it on, clubbing it in the air straight of mid-on for his first boundary
full on the stumps, pushed down the ground for one
Dhawan gets a length ball outside off - he has room to free his arms. Swings it across the line over midwicket
Mohit tightens up. Full, bang on off stump, Dhawan knocks it in front of mid-on for one
swept away to short fine leg
pushed through on off, hit to mid-on
this is speared on the stumps, but Warner manufactures swinging room by backing away outside leg. Crunched through the covers. Clean strike
this is even better. Warner charges down the track, this is tossed up on middle. Warner did not get close to this pitch but still launched it over long-on for a six
Warner goes straighter now. Some way to bring up a fifty. Floated up just outside off, no turn, Warner lofts it down the ground, sends it clattering into the sightscreen. Three boundaries in a row
Dropped. Saha shells it behind the stumps. Flatter and skids on outside off, Warner pushes at the ball and nicks it, Saha can't hang onto the chance. It bursts out
back of a length and outside off, Dhawan smacks it to the midwicket boundary. Not middled but enough to fetch a four
short of a length and angling into the left-hander, finishes on off, inside edged to leg
Warner backs away outside leg in a bid to open up the off side, but Ishant chases him. Clipped off the hips to long leg
Dhawan uses his feet, Ishant goes short and outside off. Dhawan eyes up a pull over the leg side. He ends up flat-batting it over the bowler's head
full-toss outside off, Dhawan misses out. Instead of smashing it away, he mis-hits it to the covers
a bit too full and outside off, 141ks, driven through the line to mid-off, where the fielder fumbles. Sunrisers 60 for 0 in six overs
tossed up and really full outside off, driven through the line to sweeper cover
tossed up full and outside off again, this driven back to the bowler, who makes a tumbling save to his right
darted flatter and quicker outside off, Dhawan goes down low and sweeps it fine past Saha
on a good length and outside off, no turn, Dhawan steps away outside leg and drives it inside-out over extra cover
stump-to-stump line, flat dart, flat-batted straight to cover
Warner thumps another six down the ground, exploiting the short, straight boundary. Flighted on middle, Warner gets under it and lifts it over the bowler's head. Another clean six
slides on outside off, dabbed to backward point
flighted on middle and leg, Warner charges down the track and smokes it over the short boundary. Put over long-on
slower through the air, drifts in, takes the pad and rolls to cover. One leg bye
Dragged to long-on off the inside half
long hop on the leg stump, keeps a bit low, swatted away to deep square leg
slides in with the arm on middle, no room, pushed to the right of Maxwell
pitched up full and wide outside off, Dhawan looks for an almighty hack across the line, he manages an inside edge that evades the stumps and runs away fine for four
really full and wide outside off, Dhawan opens his bat-face and carves it down to deep point
length and outside off, opens the face again and dabs it to the off side
hip-high short ball on the leg stump, Ishant is duly punished. Helped away. You can't bowl such balls with fine leg inside the circle
back of a length and outside off, Warner waits, then late-cuts it away to the right of point. Third man isn't square enough
off-stump yorker, dug out straight to point

fired outside off, dabbed late to point, where Anureet fumbles. Misses a run-out opportunity. Warner stopped midway because of a miscommunication, but had enough time to recover and complete a half-century with that single
nudged to midwicket for one. Dhawan now brings up his own fifty
hip-high ball on leg stump, swatted away
Dhawan uses his feet, Maxwell goes short and down the leg side, Dhawan simply helps it on its way. Finesse
shortish and outside off, goes low and slog-sweeps it to wide long-on
102ks full dart, rattles Warner's stumps. This was hurled full and straight, Warner aimed a slog-sweep over midwicket. He can't connect. Maxwell hits and breaks the rapid opening stand
full on off, neatly clipped through midwicket
length ball, hint of turn outside off, Williamson shovels it to long-on with the bottom hand
down the track and dragged to long-on. He did not meet the pitch
Williamson hangs back and works an incoming ball to midwicket
whipped from off stump to long-on

back of a length and angled in, Williamson uses his wrists and works it to the right of the bowler. Axar tumbles to get to the ball. He can't throw the stumps down, however, at the non-striker's end. A direct hit could have had the NZ captain
full and straight, dabbed to midwicket with soft hands
flat and outside off as he comes down the track. Dragged to long-on
tossed-up legbreak, eased with the turn to point
slid down the leg side, Dhawan can't make contact with his sweep. Beaten, wide
Dhawan shuffles across the off stump, this is flat and quick at his legs. Sweeps and finds Ishant at short fine leg
looks like an offbreak, full and comes into Williamson, he drives with the spin to long-on
Dhawan comes down the track, this is a 104ks dart, Dhawan can't get under it. He just about manages to jam it down the ground. 12 singles off 12 balls and a wide
make it 13 off 13. Lapped away to short fine leg
dropped short and wide outside off, Williamsom moves back and square-cuts it to deep point
straight ball on middle, Williamson ventures leg side of the ball and dabs a single to cover
hurled short and outside off, dragged to deep midwicket off the inside half. Dhawan does not get hold of it
half-tracker outside off,  Williamson rocks back and pulls it powerfully over the midwicket boundary
darted short and wide outside off, Dhawan drills it to wide long-off
looks like seam-up, full-toss outside off, driven crisply to the off-side sweeper
short and wide outside off, flat-batted past the diving bowler to long-off
full on off stump, pushed to long-on for one
Dhawan pre-meditates, searches for the reverse-sweep, this is fired wide outside off. Given a wide
length ball and width. Can't do that to Dhawan. Dhawan merrily swings it away to the midwicket boundary
hip-high short ball on middle and leg, Dhawan controls a pull to deep square leg
Dhawan shuffles across the off stump, this is a hip-high ball on off stump. Dhawan gets inside the line, adjusts to the slower ball and shovels it over short fine leg
Maxwell is so far inside the midwicket boundary but completes a superb overhead catch. Full and outside off - right in Dhawan's slot - he slogs it across the line and holes out to Maxwell
full and straight, Williamson twirls his wrists and gorgeously flicks it past midwicket's right. No protection in the deep there. The man is square
overpitched and outside off, leans into it and caresses a drive through the covers. Guptill mops up in the deep
hip-high short ball outside off, Williamson nails a pull.... straight to deep midwicket
length ball angled away outside off, Yuvraj, who is back from a flu- runs it down to point
101ks offbreak outside off, smeared to the covers
full and slides across off from around the stumps, Williamson chips the ball over extra cover
straight ball on middle, defended back to Maxwell with a straight bat
Yuvraj uses his feet, Maxi drags it short and outside off. Played back to him
short and slides in with the arm, Yuvraj punches it to wide long-on
speared outside off, driven through the line to sweeper
flat offbreak outside off, a lot of width for Yuvraj, he slaps it on the up to sweeper cover, where Vohra lets it burst through to the boundary. It was hit straight to hims
slapped away again, this time to Vohra's left
pushed through on off, shovelled or rather swept away to leg
wide full-toss outside off, real gift for the batsman, Yuvraj punches it square through the off side.
non-turning back of a length ball on off, stands tall and punches it straight to cover
Yuvraj skips out, but does not meet the pitch of this quickish flat ball outside off. Heaves to deep midwicket off the inside half
short rushing ball on off, Maxwell goes north of 100ks again. Yuvraj aims to pull but the bat turns on impact. He ends up skewing a simple catch to long-on
low full-toss on off, just 85ks, clean punch down to long-on
darted across off from around the wicket, the length is short, and Maxwell is cut away to sweeper
short and outside off, but does not bounce as much as Williamson anticipated. Mis-hit to long-on
full and straight, there is no midwicket, Henriques is aware of it and simply works the ball through that region
tossed on middle, but Maxwell made room, backing away outside leg, driving inside-out straight to cover
full and wide outside off, toe-ended to mid-off who is inside the circle. Morgan concedes an overthrow
very full on off stump, Williamson goes low and sweeps it powerfully over midwicket for a flat six
wide yorker outside off, Williamson still finds the boundary. He does not move his feet, but reaches out and carves it away fine of deep third man
short and wide outside off, Williamson darted around in the crease and slapped it away to the left of sweeper

What a play. This is a youtubeable moment. Williamson pre-meditated, venturing across off stump. Ishant dragged it shorter and wider outside off. Williamson still managed to swat it high in the air over midwicket. The ball was destined to sail over the boundary... until Vohra took flight. He leaps off his feet, times it superbly, plucks the ball out of thin air and pushes it back into the field of play before tumbling outside the boundary; his feet landing on the ad boards. Stunning play
wide yorker outside off - or a near yorker - Williamson reaches out with his hands and slices it away past the man at point. Ishant hasn't picked up a wicket this IPL season
backs away outside leg, reaches out to a full ball and scythes it to backward point
yorker, swerves in on leg stump, dug out in front of his feet for one
slower short ball outside off, the batsman waits for the ball to arrive, then shovels it past midwicket. 200 up for Sunrisers
off-stump yorker, squeezed straight to cover
finesse from Williamson. He scores his second fifty of this season. He pre-meditates, anticipates the slower ball outside off. He scoops it fine of short fine leg. Classy
very full on off, slower one again, clipped away smartly through midwicket
full outswinger outside off, carefully left alone
full and angling in, pushed down to mid-on for a quick one
length-ball outswinger outside off, Vohra glides it down to deep third man
Guptill lofts it through the line. So easy on the eye. Fullish and outside off, driven over extra cover
short and outside off, Guptill is stapled to the crease as he flashes and misses in the channel
belted down the ground, straight of mid-on. He has a little shimmy down the track, takes a full ball from off stump and drills it away
length ball angling away outside off, helped to deep third man
short and angling away outside off, gets on top it and defends to cover
shoulder-high short ball on off stump, good ball, but Guptill rocks back and pulls it superbly over the boundary. Clears deep square leg
Guptill hits through the line again, this time beating wide long-off (Warner) to his right. Length and outside off, driven away
slower full ball on middle, 109ks, dabbed with an open face to point
slower ball, shortish and angled into Guptill. He manages to pull it away past the right of mid-on. He did not middle it, but that's enough to beat the chasing fielder
wide of the crease, full and angled in on off stump, Vohra nurdles a single to midwicket

Bhuvneshwar hits back to dismiss Guptill. He takes pace off this. Slower ball outside off, offcutter? Guptill looks to loft it down the ground. He plays early and toe-ends the ball high in the air. Henriques gets under this skier at cover despite moths swirling around him. Oh, that's the knuckle ball from Bhuvneshwar. So Bhuvneshwar has the knuckle ball as well
back of a length and skids in to rap the thigh, leg bye
full on middle, presses forward and pushes to mid-off
back of a length and just a shade outside off, Marsh uses the pace and guides it to third man
just short of a good length and outside off, defended to cover point
pitched up and outside off, Marsh gets forward and drives in the air, but evades the fielders in the off-side ring
back of a length and outside off, leans back and cuts it square of third man, beats Bhuvneshwar
back of a length and angled in, inside edged square on the leg side
another slower ball, Nehra gets Vohra this time. Full on middle, Vohra aims to clear mid-on. He can't control the shot. Ends up chipping a catch to Kaul at mid-on
length and angling across off, flashed to point
back of a length on middle and leg, denies Marsh room, defended to midwicket
back of a length and angling away outside off, opens the face and dabs the ball to point
full and just a shade outside off, driven on the up but straight to mid-off
high bouncer outside off, aimed at the head, Marsh top-edges a hook over the keeper. A boundary after six dots
off-stump ball, Marsh opens the face and manipulates a single to deep third man

Oh dear, Maxwell has given it away for a duck. Maxwell shuffles across the off stump, this is heading towards his pads. Maxwell flicks it from there, flicks in the air, short fine leg moves to his left and snaps it up
dropped short and outside off, square cut away in the gap
back of a length and outside off, punched through the line to mid-off
tossed up on middle, Marsh uses his feet, gets close enough to the pitch and beautifully lofts it down the ground
short and outside off, goes back and belts it to the right of mid-off
hip-high short ball on off, pulled to wide long-on
another hip-high off-stump ball, swatted to deep midwicket
just short of a good length and outside off, slower offcutter at 114ks, leans back and creams a cut through point, beats Rashid to his right at sweeper
dug short and outside off, goes on the back foot and pulls to deep midwicket
back of a length and outside off, stands tall and punches to the left of Rashid at sweeper
wide of the crease, full and slow on off, pushed to mid-off
leg-side ball, deflected behind square past the keeper
back of a length and outside off, the batsman aims to force it off the back foot and ends up getting an inside edge that wanders away to leg
tossed on the pads, misses the flick as the ball rolls behind square
leg-break on the pads, deflected to leg again
short on off, pulled on the back foot to deep midwicket
length-ball googly, Morgan did not pick it. An outside edge streaks to short third man. The high-arm action and skid Rashid generates makes it tough for the batsman to pick his variations
pushed through on the pads, spins in, he still can't connect with the flick
flatter and quicker, skids in to rap the pad but this was heading down leg. Pitched outside leg too
back of a length and outside off, punched to cover
full on off, chips a drive down to long-on
full on middle, driven in the gap at extra cover for one
short ball, cramps 'em up for room. Marsh pulls and misses and cops a blow on the midriff
shoulder-high short ball on the leg stump, tucks up the left-hander, coaxes a top-edged pull. Does not carry to long leg
Morgan pre-meditates shuffles a fair way across off. Kaul spots it and sends down a 120ks slower ball wide past him. Morgan fetches it from there and shovels it to the midwicket region
pushed through outside off, full, forward and driven through the line to cover
short and skids on top of middle, Morgan cuts it from the stumps. Risky
legbreak, comes in, inside-edged onto the pad
dragged short and outside off, Rashid continues to dart it in. Dragged to long-on
Marsh can't pick the googly again. Tossed up, starts around off and spins away, past the outside edge
follows it with a flick slider that cramps Marsh for room and raps him on the thigh. Rashid has give away just two off two overs. Excellent
short of a length and wide outside off, Morgan sends it clatter away to the extra-cover boundary with a cut
short and wide outside off again, Morgan cracks it away again, beating sweeper cover to his left
short of a length and angled in on off, whipped away to midwicket
hip-high short ball on off, Marsh drags a pull to Dhawan at deep square leg
slower offcutter outside off, Mogan waits for it, then cuts to deep point
back of a length on leg stump, whipped to deep midwicket
Marsh breaks free. Rashid goes short and gives width outside off, cut away past a diving Yuvraj at backward point
pushed through on a fourth-stump line, Morgan skips back and lashes it to cover
full on off stump, no turn, goes low and slog-sweeps to deep midwicket
101ks slider angling across off, goes on the back foot and punches to cover
slower legbreak, dips, takes the inside edge and runs to square leg
bang! back of a length and outside off, Morgan clears his front leg and whacks it over wide long-on
back of a length on middle and leg, this is pulled to Dhawan at deep midwicket
back of a length on middle, hacked away in the gap between deep midwicket and long-on. Off the inside half, and that's enough for Marsh to get to his fifty
beats long-on to his right. Short of a length and wide outside off, Marsh fetches it from there and flat-bats it down the ground

Dropped and Hooda lets it through to the boundary. Short and outside off, Marsh goes for a pull. He gets more height as opposed to distance. This is a real skier. Hooda runs to his left from deep midwicket and shells it
slower offcutter outside off, fools the batsman. He jabs early and misses
Hooda finds redemption. Tossed up, possibly a top spinner outside off. Morgan goes low for a slog-sweep. Ends up top-edging a catch to wide long-on
Marsh comes down the track to this skiddy legbreak on middle, ends up chopping the ball to cover
length-ball legbreak, 100ks, takes the outside edge and rolls to point
low full-toss, dips on him, swept to short fine leg
full on middle stump, he lifts it over the bowler's head, the beats long-on to his right. Rashid ends with exceptional figures of 4-0-16-1
back of a length on off, cramps Saha, chopped to Yuvraj at backward point. A direct hit could have had Marsh
short and wide outside off, flayed away to the right of sweeper cover, Hooda dives to his right but still the ball bursts through
full and wide outside off, Marsh reaches out and lofts it over extra cover. Sends it into the stands

Dropped. Bursts through the hands of Warner running in from deep midwicket. Back of a length on middle, fiercely clubbed away. Warner would have been better off had he stayed at the edge of the boundary I suppose
chest-high wide full-toss outside off, Kaul puts his hand up in apology right away. No-ball. It slipped out of his hands
leg-stump yorker, great comeback from Kaul, squeezed down to long-on
This wasn't really short enough for the pull. In-between length, Saha attempts to pull and drags it back onto the off stump off the inside edge
Bhuvneshwar aims for the wide yorker.  But he goes too full and that is sliced away past short third man
back of a length on leg stump, cramps him for room. Marsh can't whip it away to leg. The ball hits the thigh pad and dribbles away to cover
back of a length and just outside off, Axar drags it to long-on

Has Bhuvneshwar closed out the game? Floats a knuckle ball on the off stump, dips as Marsh looks to pull it away. Instead, he can only drag off the bottom of the bat it to Deepak Hooda - the ball has kept following him - who hangs on to the skier after a bobble at deep midwicket
back of a length on off, clipped away through midwicket
full and outside off, guided to the covers
Anureet shuffles across off, full on middle, pushed through mid-on
Anureet now moves away outside leg, this is a slower ball chasing him. He dabs it down to third man
full and very wide outside off, Axar has to reach out a long way for it, he ends up bottom-edging past Ojha diving across to his left
Nehra goes full and wide outside off again. He is taken to the boundary again. He reaches out and smacks it through extra cover
back of a length and angled into the thigh, punched to wide long-on for a couple
dug short and outside off, Axar splices a pull to deep midwicket
back of a length and outside off, Axar swings at it and skies it.... Williamson tears in from long-on, dives forward for a one-handed catch, but the ball evades him
short and outside off, dragged away to deep midwicket
Anureet moves away outside leg. Kaul digs it short and outside off, flat-batted down the ground
slower ball outside off, 114ks, Axar slogs at it but ends up skying it straighter to the left of long-off. Warner settles under it
Kaul errs in length. Full-toss, just below the waist on middle, Anureet wallops it over midwicket for a four
The batsman backs away outside leg, Anureet follows him. Back of a length, pushed through the covers
slower ball outside off, the batsman swings early and does not make contact
nails an off-stump yorker, tinged with inswing, jammed down towards long-on
Mohit stays leg side of the ball and guides it to point
Anureet darts around in the crease, this is slower and wider outside off, possibly a knuckle ball, sliced away in the air between short third man and backward point. Too little, too late for Kings
length ball on off, flat-batted down to long-off
Mohit comes down the track but is cramped for room. Drags it to deep midwicket
back of a length and angling across off, Mohit looks to clatter it over midwicket. He is beaten in the end
The ball keeps following Hooda. Full and outside off, Mohit again stays leg side of the ball and ends up skewing it in the air - he was probably going over cover - to deep point
yorker on off, or a near yorker, jammed down to long-off
Nehra cramps Ishant with a short ball on the leg stump, Ishant looks away, pulls, and edges it past the keeper
length ball on off, backs away outside leg, and toe-ends a slog to long-on
full-toss outside off, Anureet clears his front leg swings it straight down the throat of Williamson at long-off. That is that. Sunrisers secure their first away win of the season
